content.description: Sit start with the same sequence as Secret Garden and Appreciation Station, then traverse right after the cross using the underclings from Garden Gnome to avoid the moving and broken holds. Grab the first juggy undercling and a right sidepull then top out.The last flake from Appreciation is off - it's about to break - and so is the loose corner of the Garden Gnome start hold.
content.protection: two pads will work if you slide them, the landing is flat but the traverse is long
content.location: Same start as Secret Garden, near by Pipe Dream and Nice Slot

content.description: Start low on the right side of the quartz intrusion, left hand under the ledge, right on a detached block that moves, but I don't think is going anywhere. Using jugs and crimps both in and to the right of the intrusion, top out pretty much straight up. The flake with the chalk X in the picture is on, but it's not going to last much longer; my next project will be finding a variation that bypasses it.
content.location: Secret Garden area, just upstream from Nice Slot, and a couple hundred feet downstream from the Roof Area.

content.description: Start low on the wide crimp below the large fallen tree (utilizing either a wide right toe-hook or cramped face smears). Work your way rightwards to another wide crimp, and then straight up for an easy mantle.
Lowball roof topout! Good for learning body positioning in topouts and Probably the lowest/shortest climb in all NWB!
content.location: Look at secret garden/kinder garden. Turn around 180 degrees and see the small overhang that the tree is resting on. Sitstart at the bottom left and climb the lip.

content.description:
Start far right on the large triangular fin and traverse left, moving your hands over the top lip of the boulder.

 Note: I've not seen this route posted before, and I've been unable to find an official name. I've given this problem a temporary name, but if anyone is aware of the name given by the first ascensionist, I will update this page accordingly.
content.location: On the Secret Garden boulder.

content.description: Sitstart at the bottom right and climb up and left to top out same as Pipe Dream when you hit the jug. Watch the pointy rock behind you.
content.location: The arete to the right of Pipe Dream

content.description: Start on a large, left facing side pull on the left side of the Nice Slot boulder. Climb up and to the right on good but sharp crimps, including a so-so-sized slot, until you get to the good side pulls near the top of Nice Slot. Top out from there.
content.protection: 1-2 pads if you trust yourself to not go over the six foot wide landing ledge, 2-3 pads and some spotters if you don't.
content.location: A few feet to the left of Nice Slot. Boulder is located on the south bank, upstream and uphill from The Tick boulder. Near the green pipe.

content.description: Start matched on same left facing side pull as "The Pipeline", move right onto the start of "Nice Slot" then finish by matching hands in the large hole. This variation has likely been done before and is similar to "Nice Slot" but avoids the more challenging moves at the top. Figured I would put this up to add an easier variation to the boulder.
content.location: Same boulder as Nice Slot

content.description: Same as The Pipeline, but use the left arete once you get to the right sidepulls instead of going straight up the face on crimps. (This is assuming the arete is off for the original Pipeline climb but let me know)
content.location: Same as The Pipeline

content.description: Start on two small but obvious crimps at shoulder level.  The left hand crimp is much smaller than the right, and the right is slightly higher than the left.  Place your foot on the rail below you. Proceed up mediocre crimps to the sloped top of the boulder and top out. A very clean, short line.Grade is just a suggestion, but let me know your grade opinion!  It is difficult to judge the grade of such a short climb. (Feel free to suggest any other input or information that would be helpful!)
content.location: When facing the Secret Garden Boulder, turn 180 degrees around and you'll see the small, pyramid shaped boulder slightly to the right.  Pipe Dream climbs up the face of that boulder.

content.description: Solid holds. Modern moderate test piece for Northwest Branch bouldering community. Don’t fall once committed to upper section. footage: youtu.be/2YsGNm_XqHc
content.location: Tiered Boulder en route from Tick Boulder to Nice Slot boulder

content.description: Crux lip encounter. Good problem. Low end for grade FA: Kensie Whitfield / John Chipouras 2016?
content.location: Tiered Boulder en route from Tick Boulder to Nice slot Boulder. See photo

content.description: Adding to the variations!  The name says it all.  Sit start same as Nice Slot Sit Start, then climb Nice Slot Direct.  Not totally sure about the FA (as you never can be), so if someone has already climbed this, let me know so they can be given credit!
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter ideally.
content.location: Same as Nice Slot.

content.description:
The full Nice Slot line. Start matched on a decent hold on the bottom left of the boulder, make a big move into the start of Nice Slot, and then climb Nice Slot. Don't read the next line if you don't want beta on the start.

 Beta on the start: I used a left heel hook in the hole/slot feature on the far bottom left of the boulder and a right foot on the nice ledge under the start.
content.protection: 1-2 pads if you're not worried about going over the ledge, several pads and at least one spotter if you are.
content.location: Start is on the bottom left of the Nice Slot/Pipeline Boulder, whichever you call it. Located directly across the stream from Chaos Roof/Snowflake boulder, about 50m upstream from The Tick boulder and maybe 30m downstream from the Secret Garden boulder.

content.description:
Same start as Nice Slot.  Climb directly up into two small crimps, deadpoint to another good crimp, and proceed up the last few moves of Nice Slot.  

 I would not be surprised if the FA for this climb is incorrect, so let me know if it is not! Thanks!
content.location: Same boulder as Nice Slot

content.description: Start with both hands in sequential pockets on the chest-height diagonal seam. Move right and up to match hands in the large hole. Move left to a gaston and then eventually a matching layback. Finish by moving up the blank face and topping out.
content.protection: The landing is perfectly flat onto a 5-foot wide ledge, then the ledge ends and there's a sharp 4 foot fall to another ledge. A spotter is a good idea to keep from tumbling off the first ledge.
content.location: Just before and beneath the large green pipeline. The boulder has red graffiti labeling the boulder as "The Throne" with a crown.

content.description: This climb is basically just 2 moves and a top out. It would be a good beginner climb.
content.location: Left most side of the Boulder with kinder garden on it. Start on the big obvious ledge.

content.description:
I’m not sure if this has been climbed before, so the FA is unknown.

 Sit start just right of the vertical crack on the jug, move up and left into the diagonal seam, traverse left under the tree, and top out without using the ledge.
content.location: On the Garden Boulder

content.description:
Start just right of the white vertical crack on a mini flake. Move up and left to several good holds in the diagonal seam and top out.

 Note: There are various accounts of this problem as "unknown", and I've been unable to find an official name. I've given this problem a temporary name, but if anyone is aware of the name given by the first ascensionist, I will update this page accordingly.
content.location: On the Secret Garden boulder.

climbs.name: I Don’t Like Shit, I Don’t Go Outside

content.description: Start with hands in two obvious, good fingerlocks; feet where you like. Feet first is easiest, I think. Do some toehooking, hand shuffling shenanigans to top out via the obvious juggy flake. It‘s probably best not to fall at the end, as you could take a massive ride down the hill and into some rocks/the river. Be careful with your belongings for the same reason. Not a great boulder, but pretty fun if you’re in the area and like cracks.
content.protection: Thin padding. It’s a lowball. A spotter would be nice, as long as they are VERY sure of their footing.
content.location: If you look at Pipe Dream, locate the boulder maybe 10 feet left of it. It’s located on the backside of that boulder, near the river. If you’re under Ultimate Doom and look to the other side of the river you can see it.

content.description: Sit start in the center of the face on the large undercling, sharing a start with Teacher Appreciation. Make a move upwards to a better hold, than traverse to the right, finding the large undercling flake a few feet away. Once you reach the righthand side of the flake, which is the start of Public Garden (and the tip of the sleeping gnome's hat!), traverse back left on the lip, continuing through to top out just left of the start and right of the large fallen tree.
content.protection: 2 pads, or someone to drag one under you as you traverse
content.location: On the Secret Garden boulder.

content.description:
Same start and crux as Secret Garden, but rather than going directly up on the juggy crimps above, traverse down into the start of Kinder Garden (to the right of the quartz seam).  Climb up through a few bumpy crimp moves and top out to the right of the quartz seam.

 The highlighted section of the image is the general path this problem follows.

 Super fun if you enjoyed Secret Garden and want to try something with some funky beta!

 If you have any opinions/suggestions about this climb please let me know!  (grade, beta, etc.)
On the south bank between the walking path and the river. These boulders are situated near a large green pipeline running overhead.
